page.title: 01Surrounds of Preston Village
page.content: This area lies on the South Eastern slopes of the Lammermuir Hills and is dissected by the Whiteadder Water - well known to trout fishermen. The country is divided into two types of farming - cultivated crops on the lower ground to the South with hill pasture accommodating sheep to the North. Fields, valleys and grazing lands are pleasantly dotted with stands of trees mostly deciduous trees, although there are more recent plantings of conifers. Preston is the only village in the area - small farming community with no shops. Nearby is Cockburn Mill, now a private house, but still retains the old wooden mill machinery driven by water power. This area is overlooked from the NW by Cockburn Law. 1066ft on which are the remains of an earthwork fortification of prehistoric times.
